But precisely because everyoneâ€™s staring gape-mouthed in his direction
column2: other world leaders are able to get away with almost anything. Donâ€™t believe me? Look one country north
column3: at Justin Trudeau. Look all you want
column4: in fact â€“ he sure is cute
column5: the planetâ€™s only sovereign leader who appears to have recently quit a boy band. And heâ€™s mastered so beautifully the politics of inclusion: compassionate to immigrants
column6: insistent on including women at every level of government. Give him great credit where itâ€™s deserved: in lots of ways heâ€™s the anti-Trump
column7: and itâ€™s no wonder Canadians swooned when he took over. But when it comes to the defining issue of our day
column9: heâ€™s a brother to the old orange guy in Washington.Â  Not rhetorically: Trudeau says all the right things
column10: over and over. Heâ€™s got no Scott Pruitts in his cabinet: everyone who works for him says the right things. Indeed
column11: they specialize in getting others to say them too â€“ it was Canadian diplomats
column14: who pushed at the Paris climate talks for a tougher-than-expected goal: holding the planetâ€™s rise in temperature to 1.5C (2.7F).  But those words are meaningless if you keep digging up more carbon and selling it to people to burn
column15: and thatâ€™s exactly what Trudeau is doing. Heâ€™s hard at work pushing for new pipelines through Canada and the US to carry yet more oil out of Albertaâ€™s tar sands
column16: which is one of the greatest climate disasters on the planet.  Last month
column17: speaking at a Houston petroleum industry gathering
column18: he got a standing ovation from the oilmen for saying: â€œNo country would find 173bn barrels of oil in the ground and just leave them there.â€ Yes
column19: 173bn barrels is indeed the estimate for recoverable oil in the tar sands. So letâ€™s do some math. If Canada digs up that oil and sells it to people to burn
column21: according to the math whizzes at Oil Change International
column22: 30% of the carbon necessary to take us past the 1.5C target that Canada helped set in Paris.  That is to say
column24: which represents one half of 1% of the planetâ€™s population
column25: is claiming the right to sell the oil that will use up a third of the earthâ€™s remaining carbon budget. Trump is a creep and a danger and unpleasant to look at
column26: but at least heâ€™s not a stunning hypocrite.  Continue Reading. " False link

column1: slimygrrrl 157071702308 "2017-02-10 20:19:54 GMT" http://slimygrrrl.tumblr.com/post/157071702308/pornhub-just-launched-a-surprising-new-site "ashley-wants-a-tank: dr-archeville:   For a growing number of American kids
column2: porn is their sex ed.Â   Now Pornhub is hoping to offer their audience some more formal lessons  in how to be a healthy and happy sexual being. On Wednesday
column3: the massive adult entertainment destination took the  somewhat surprising step of launching the â€œPornhub Sexual Health  Center.â€Â  Theyâ€™re hoping the free sub-site  will become a go-to resource for some of their 70 million daily users  on all manner of topics
column5: sexual safety and how to manage  relationships. Theyâ€™ve chosen Dr. Laurie Betito
column7: to direct  the site and theyâ€™ll also be working with a number of doctors
column8: therapists and other experts to offer advice and answer questions.Â  Corey  Price
column11: â€œOur goal is  to provide our visitors with a site that has credible and insightful  information
column12: rather than have them scouring the internet.â€ While itâ€™s a database theyâ€™ll build up over time
column13: a first look  reveals theyâ€™ve started with the fundamentals â€” with answers to things  like â€œBabies. Where do they come from?â€ and â€œAre there really three  holes?â€Â  These might seems almost laughably basic to adult consumers of  hardcore porn
column14: but there are a lot of young people for whom these are  very real questions.  Price told Mashable they werenâ€™t aiming the content  specifically at beginners.Â  He said they simply want to appeal to â€œthose  who are looking for trustworthy sex tips and health advice provided by  experts.â€Â  But it seems like they realize this could prove to be an  especially valuable resource for their younger audience
column15: who most likely  isnâ€™t getting comprehensive (much less sex-positive) sex ed in schools. There are
column17: plenty of online sexual health and education  resources
column19: landing on sites like Pornhub is already  their way into learning about sex.Â  Porn can obviously teach you plenty  about the basics and mechanics of intercourse
column20: but thereâ€™s a whole range  of other things â€” biology
column24: just to name a few â€” that you wonâ€™t pick up from watching  videos like â€œBig tits round assesâ€ or â€œSloppy throat games.â€  So if they can slide their curious audience over to the PSHC while  theyâ€™re already on the site
column25: it could function as pretty useful one-stop  shop for filling in the blanks left by spotty sex ed classes and the  birds and bees talks given by often bewildered parents.   Neat!  Holy shit their section on trans people was actually really good and not what I expected from something hosted by a porn site! If they had a containing various sexualities and whatnot as well
